text: Paralepetopsis ferrugivora is a species of sea snail, a true limpet, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Neolepetopsidae, one of the families of true limpets. ==Description== The largest reported specimen was 9.2 mm in diameter.http://www.malacolog.org/search.php?mode=details&waspid;=5698 ==Habitat== The species is normally found in deep-sea hydrothermal vents and seeps. They have been found in the Mid Atlantic Ridge.http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=180859 They can survive in water from 2.52–4.96 degrees Celsius, and at depths from 1,620–3,500 feet.http://eol.org/pages/4930444/overview ==References== ==External links== * Category:Neolepetopsidae Category:Gastropods described in 2001
title: Paralepetopsis ferrugivora
